text: That stupid “punk rock” answer and lack of understanding of what he’s talking about re:Alan Moore is everything I hate about Gen X sneering cultural politics https://t.co/icTy8RBq3S

@ChampagneSharks He also didn't do Swamp Thing until Len Wein, the original creator, gave him the okay to rewrite his origin. He only did Miracleman cause he thought Mick Anglo was getting money. The whole "punk rock" shit is so dumb

In reality, Alan Moore actually wanted to do Watchmen using existing heroes fromthat DC owned. His editor told him he couldn’t do things so drastic with their IP and it would be disrespectful to their characters...and Moore respected it and created original characters! https://t.co/js0uSfxfOL

Another way Lindelof is clueless and I also blame the modern “journalists” for this because they just applauded like seals and didn’t fact check anything he said is when he claimed he was doing what Alan Moore would have done by ignoring the wishes of others. https://t.co/VGqZgcb6DQ

He said you can watch our show first, then treat the graphic novel as a little prequel to read after the fact to add some extra context to our show. Yes, Moore’s Watchmen reduced to extra homework to give context to Lindelof’s lol https://t.co/Z5pbQ9VbQN

He’s also so insanely arrogant about how good his mystery box show with nothing to say is compared to the original masterpiece that he compares his derivative prestige show as being The Godfather 2 to the original Watchmen’a Godfather, that you can watch them in either order https://t.co/QRZ7q7JCuI
Wrong article link. Here is the right article link https://t.co/evUKy6ZK3V

See, we have disdain for the center because they don’t choose a side, which makes no sense because the center is a choice not the lack of a choice. But he says people who choose extremes are bad too. So what’s left? https://t.co/rB3f2fMbFY

This is total Gen X nonpolitics of “taking the piss out of everyone” and “pissing off the squares of both sides” as meaningful discourse despite not really saying anything outside of being smug, self-satisfied and marginally edgy. What does this passage even mean? https://t.co/9sivbdhJGJ

that people think the guy who gave this intellectually incurious politically brain-dead interview could match Moore’s Watchmen is amazing to me. If you can read this interview and not see how ridiculously shallow Watchmen is I don’t know what to tell you https://t.co/KVuV77hL05

I firmly believe that no matter how much I like or dislike a piece of art, getting personally offended and angry at someone else for having a good faith different opinion on it is moronic. However seeing someone say Lindelof’s Watchmen surpassed Moore’s was a real test for me
